articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas is set to hand over three Israeli hostages on Saturday in exchange for Palestinian detainees and prisoners in the latest stage of a ceasefire deal aimed at opening the way to ending the 15-month war in Gaza.
articles.title: Hamas set to release three Israeli hostages as Gaza ceasefire holds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five Thai nationals held captive by Hamas for over a year returned to Thailand on Sunday, reuniting with their tearful families at Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi Airport.
articles.title: Thai nationals held captive by Hamas for 15 months return home

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Trump on Friday said he would have relations with North Korea.
articles.title: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un vows to further develop nuclear forces

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia is yet to see any positive steps from the new U.S. administration on disarmament, Russia's permanent representative to the United Nations in Geneva said in an interview published on Sunday.
articles.title: Russia says it sees no positive steps from US on disarmament, RIA reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba expressed optimism on Sunday that his country could avoid higher U.S. tariffs, saying President Donald Trump had "recognised" Japan's huge investment in the U.S. and the American jobs that it creates.
articles.title: Japan PM Ishiba, after meeting Trump, voices optimism over averting tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than three dozen people have died in an accident involving a bus in southern Mexico, local media reported on Saturday, as local authorities expressed condolences to the families of the victims.
articles.title: More than three dozen killed in bus accident in southern Mexico, local media says

articles.author: Rich McKay
articles.description: As the wreckage of a Cessna 208B Grand Caravan that crashed on Thursday, killing all 10 on board, drifts on a Bering Sea ice floe, a crew of nine investigators from the National Transportation Safety Board arrived in Anchorage, Alaska, on Saturday to find out why it crashed.
articles.title: Alaska plane crash: investigators hunt for clues

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sam Nujoma, the activist and guerrilla leader who became Namibia's first democratically elected president after it won its independence from apartheid South Africa, died aged 95 on Saturday, the Namibian Presidency said in a post on X on Sunday.
articles.title: Namibia's 'founding father' Sam Nujoma dies aged 95, Presidency says
Leaders from Eastern and Southern African blocs seek solutions to Congo conflict

articles.author: John Irish, Clotaire Achi
articles.description: Thousands of opponents to Iran's authorities rallied in Paris on Saturday, joined by Ukrainians to call for the fall of the government in Tehran, hopeful that U.S. President Donald Trump's 'maximum pressure' campaign could lead to change in the country.
articles.title: Emboldened by Trump, Iranian dissidents demand overthrow of rulers
